title: Drawing, "Design for Musaphonic Clock Radio, in Blue, General Electric", 1958
medium: pastel, gouache, watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite on vellum
signed: in graphite, lower right: R. Arbib '58
inscribed: On design, in yellow gouache: Musaphonic;  in graphite: GENERAL [GE symbol] Electric; ALAR[M]; SLEEP; AUTO; OFF; ON; numbers for tuning, between knobs: 5 6 7 8 9 10 12 14 16.
provenance: Norman Brosterman, New York, NY; Richard Arbib, New York, NY
creditline: Museum purchase through the gift of Mrs. Edward C. Post
description: Perspective for clock radio, featuring larger speaker enclosure on left hand side and smaller tuning and clock enclosure on right hand side.  Speaker features a concave "v"-shaped grill with brass band surround and "Musiphonic" script at lower right.  Tuning and volume knobs feature are white with brass inserts.  Three clock control knobs in white. Clock hands in brass with blue insert.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Musaphonic Clock Radio, in Blue, General Electric", 1958.
1958. pastel, gouache, watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite on vellum. Museum purchase through the gift of Mrs. Edward C. Post. 1992-183-5.
